p: From October 31 to November 12, 2021, Glasgow, Scotland, hosted the 26th United Nations Climate Change conference, known as Conference of the Parties (COP) 26. Expectations were at an all-time high as this negotiation was widely seen to be the last best chance for governments to come to an agreement that would hold global temperature increases to 1.5° Celsius in accordance with the 2015 Paris Agreement. In an effort to ensure that the Paris Agreement’s commitment for a “right to health” would be meaningfully implemented in the pact, the World Health Organization-hosted Pavilion saw 10 days of presentations and discussions dedicated to placing health and equity “at the centre of climate negotiations” (World Health Organization [WHO], 2021; p.VIII).
